q: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
h:
“If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.” —
Criss Jami

q: Where there is no vision, the people perish.
h:
“How you think is as important as as what you think.” —
Unknown

q: I must follow the people. Am I not their leader?
h:
“Become the kind of leader that people would follow voluntarily, even if you had no title or position.” —
Brian Tracy

q: You manage things; you lead people.
h:
“Being In The Present Means Tuning Out Distractions And Paying Attention To What Is Important, Now.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: The first responsibility of a leader is to define reality. The last is to say thank you. In between, the leader is a servant.
h:
“Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Leadership is the capacity to translate vision into reality.
h:
“Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Lead me, follow me, or get out of my way.
h:
“Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.” —
W. Clement Stone

q: Before you are a leader, success is all about growing yourself. When you become a leader, success is all about growing others.
h:
“Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: A leader is a dealer in hope.
h:
“You need to be doing fewer things for more effect instead of doing more things with side effects.” —
Gary Keller

q: You don’t need a title to be a leader.
h:
“Only when you can be extremely pliable and soft can you be extremely hard and strong.” —
Zen Proverb

q: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
h:
“Sorrow is how we learn to love.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: The nation will find it very hard to look up to the leaders who are keeping their ears to the ground.
h:
“Learn the rules like a pro, so you can break them like an artist.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: To command is to serve, nothing more and nothing less.
h:
“Dreams are the touchstones of our characters.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: He who has never learned to obey cannot be a good commander.
h:
“The strongest and sweetest songs yet remain to be sung.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Become the kind of leader that people would follow voluntarily; even if you had no title or position.
h:
“The big secret in life is that there is no big secret. Whatever your goal, you can get there if you're willing to work.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Anyone can hold the helm when the sea is calm.
h:
“Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Leadership is influence.
h:
“Fallacies do not cease to be fallacies because they become fashions.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: People buy into the leader before they buy into the vision.
h:
“Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.” —
Coco Chanel

q: So much of what we call management consists in making it difficult for people to work.
h:
“Champions keep playing until they get it right.” —
Billie Jean King

q: The art of leadership is saying no, not saying yes. It is very easy to say yes.
h:
“One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: A ruler should be slow to punish and swift to reward.
h:
“If you focus on success, you'll have stress. But if you pursue excellence, success will be guaranteed.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself, or to get all the credit for doing it.
h:
“In order for you to be the BEST you can be for others, first you must be BEST for yourself.” —
Jeffrey Gitomer

q: Leaders think and talk about the solutions. Followers think and talk about the problems.
h:
“We turn not older with years but newer every day.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: A man who wants to lead the orchestra must turn his back on the crowd.
h:
“Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: As we look ahead into the next century, leaders will be those who empower others.
h:
“Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Do what you feel in your heart to be right–for you’ll be criticized anyway.
h:
“It is very obvious that we are not influenced by 'facts' but by our interpretation of the facts.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Don't necessarily avoid sharp edges. Occasionally they are necessary to leadership.
h:
“Anger begins with folly, and ends with repentance. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: Education is the mother of leadership.
h:
“Know your gifts and share them.” —
Les Brown

q: Effective leadership is putting first things first. Effective management is discipline, carrying it out.
h:
“Why live an ordinary life, when you can live an extraordinary one.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Great leaders are not defined by the absence of weakness, but rather by the presence of clear strengths.
h:
“We've got to live, no matter how many skies have fallen.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: He who has great power should use it lightly.
h:
“We are all self-made, but only the successful will admit it.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: He who has learned how to obey will know how to command.
h:
“From a certain point onward there is no longer any turning back. That is the point that must be reached.” —
Franz Kafka

q: If one is lucky, a solitary fantasy can totally transform one million realities.
h:
“If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock.
h:
“Don't look for meaning in the words. Listen to the silences.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: It is absurd that a man should rule others, who cannot rule himself.
h:
“I would rather be a little nobody, then to be an evil somebody.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: Leaders must be close enough to relate to others, but far enough ahead to motivate them.
h:
“Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.
h:
“Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.” —
Rumi

q: Leadership does not always wear the harness of compromise.
h:
“FEAR has two meanings: 'Forget Everything And Run' or 'Face Everything And Rise.' The choice is yours.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Leadership is the key to 99 percent of all successful efforts.
h:
“Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.” —
Soren Kierkegaard

q: Leadership is unlocking people's potential to become better.
h:
“Most of us live our lives by accident - we live as it happens. Fulfilment comes when we live our lives on purpose.” —
Simon Sinek

q: Management is about arranging and telling. Leadership is about nurturing and enhancing.
h:
“Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?” —
Rumi

q: Never give an order that can't be obeyed.
h:
“People spend too much time doing and not enough time thinking about what they should be doing.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: No man is good enough to govern another man without that other's consent.
h:
“There is a big difference between being centered and being self-centered.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: What you do has far greater impact than what you say.
h:
“Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Not the cry, but the flight of a wild duck, leads the flock to fly and follow.
h:
“If it entertains you now but will bore you someday, it's a distraction. Keep looking.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: One of the tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency.
h:
“Work is always an antidote to depression.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: The greatest leaders mobilize others by coalescing people around a shared vision.
h:
“Adults are just children who earn money.” —
Kenneth Branagh

q: The growth and development of people is the highest calling of leadership.
h:
“Don't try to be young. Just open your mind. Stay interested in stuff.” —
Betty White

q: To have long term success as a coach or in any position of leadership, you have to be obsessed in some way.
h:
“Today will never happen again. Don't waste it with a false start or no start at all.” —
Og Mandino

q: Whatever you are, be a good one.
h:
“There are more people who wish to be loved than there are who are willing to love. ” —
Nicolas Chamfort
